pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 1
Release Date : 04/4/2025
Due Date : 05/5/2025, Wednesday
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
CLO1: Follow the techniques used in the planning, requirements gathering, analysis
and design of an information systems project in a team; (A3, PLO4, MQFC3b)
CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

th

desired improvements.

th

CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 1
Release Date : 04/4/2025
Due Date : 05/5/2025, Wednesday
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
CLO1: Follow the techniques used in the planning, requirements gathering, analysis
and design of an information systems project in a team; (A3, PLO4, MQFC3b)
CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 1
Release Date : 04/4/2025
Due Date : 05/5/2025, Wednesday
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
CLO1: Follow the techniques used in the planning, requirements gathering, analysis
and design of an information systems project in a team; (A3, PLO4, MQFC3b)
CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.

milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.

th
 June 2025

that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.

Recommended completion: 5
th

th

organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 1
Release Date : 04/4/2025
Due Date : 05/5/2025, Wednesday
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
CLO1: Follow the techniques used in the planning, requirements gathering, analysis
and design of an information systems project in a team; (A3, PLO4, MQFC3b)
CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 1
Release Date : 04/4/2025
Due Date : 05/5/2025, Wednesday
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
CLO1: Follow the techniques used in the planning, requirements gathering, analysis
and design of an information systems project in a team; (A3, PLO4, MQFC3b)
CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6,
MQFC3d)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
You have recently joined an organization as a System Analyst. Your primary responsibility is to
analyze, design, and implement a computerized information system that aligns with the
organization’s business objectives and supports its users. The organization has identified the
need for an efficient information system to enhance its operations. Your tasks are to lead the
analysis and design process for this information system.
Task 1: Problem Identification and Business Context (15 Marks)
Recommended completion: 9
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the problem that the organization is facing and provide a clear
business context for the project.
•Business Context (5 Marks): Provide a comprehensive overview of the organization's
background, industry, and key business objectives. 
•Problem Definition (5 Marks): Clearly describe the problem or challenge that the

organization is currently facing. Identify the areas where the existing processes are
lacking or causing inefficiencies. Explain how the problem aligns with the
organization's strategic goals.
•Stakeholder Identification (5 Marks): List and briefly describe the primary stakeholders
who will be impacted by the project. Explain their roles and interests in the project's
success.
Task 2: Project Scope and Objectives (10 Marks)
Recommended completion: 16
th
 May 2025
In this task, you will define the scope of the project and outline its key objectives.
•Project Scope (5 Marks): Clearly define the boundaries of the project. Identify what is
included and exclude from the project scope. Describe any limitations or constraints
that might impact on the project's scope.
•Project Objectives (5 Marks): Define specific and measurable objectives for the project.
These objectives should align with addressing the identified problem and achieving
desired improvements.
Task 3: High-Level Requirements and Deliverables (25 Marks)
Recommended completion: 5
th
 June 2025
In this task, you will outline the high-level requirements of the project and identify the
deliverables that will be produced.
•Explore fact-finding methods (15 Marks): Introduce at least three fact-finding methods
(e.g. interviews, surveys, observation) that can be utilized to gather information about
the organization's processes and requirements. Discuss the advantages and
disadvantages of each method, considering factors like time, cost, and accuracy.
•High-Level Requirements (10 Marks): List the main functional and non-functional
requirements for the project. These should provide a high-level understanding of what
the solution needs to achieve. Functional requirements define the system's features and
capabilities, while non-functional requirements outline performance, security, and user
experience criteria.

Task 4: Project scheduling and organization (40 Marks)
Recommended completion: 28
th
 June 2025
•Development Model and Deliverables (15 Marks): Analyze the organization's needs
and constraints to justify the choice of a specific development model (e.g., waterfall,
spiral, agile). Highlight the benefits and drawbacks of the chosen model and explain
how its phases align with the system's development. Detail the deliverables expected at
each phase to ensure transparency and effective progress tracking.
•Gantt Chart (5 Marks): Create a Gantt Chart illustrating the project timeline and
milestones.
•Work Breakdown Structure (10 Marks): Develop a WBS in the specified format,
detailing tasks, durations, and task dependencies to ensure a structured approach to
project execution.
•Roles and Responsibilities (10 Marks): Describes the key roles supporting the project.
Task 5: Peer Evaluation (Individual Submission) 10 MARKS
Recommended completion: 29
th
 June 2025
Please fill in the evaluation form given below and submit individually to the submission link
given on the HLMS.
Peer evaluation is a crucial component of teamwork, enabling us to recognize and acknowledge
the efforts and contributions of each team member. This process fosters fairness, accountability,
and mutual respect within the team.
Discussion and Clarification: Feel free to discuss any concerns or disagreements regarding
peer evaluations with your teammates. Open communication can help resolve
misunderstandings and lead to a more accurate assessment.
Responsibility and Respect: Remember that your evaluation affects your peers' grades and
overall experience. Take this responsibility seriously and demonstrate respect for each other's
efforts.

• Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy, user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
• Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

(10 Marks)

th

Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the

(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized

(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,

TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file.

Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.

TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file.

th
 August 2025

Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.

pdfDetails.extractedText:
DIP103/ DIP1SAD01
Introduction to Analysis and Design
Semester 2, 2025
Assignment No : 2
Release Date : 12/05/2025
Due Date : 13/07/2025
Value : 30% of final total
Assessment Type : Group Assignment (4 - 5 students per group)
Course Learning Outcomes
This assignment assesses the following learning outcomes:
•CLO2: Produce artifacts for an information system using CASE tools (C3, PLO6, MQFC3d)
•CLO3: Describe management and security issues in the implementation of information systems.
(C2,PLO1, MQFC1)
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
Congratulations on completing Assignment 1 and creating the Project Charter for the computerized information
system! In this second assignment, you will delve into key aspects of Requirement Modelling, Process Modelling,
Data Modelling, Systems Architecture, and Systems Implementation. Each section is designed to build on your
understanding of system analysis and design concepts. Your task is to demonstrate your knowledge and skills in
each of these areas.
TASK 1: DOCUMENTATION (70 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 30
th
 July 2025
Create a document that contains the following information:
(a)Use Case Diagrams: Create a Use Case Diagram for the computerized information system. Identify the
main actors and use cases and illustrate their interactions. (10 Marks) 
(b)Context Diagram: Construct a Context Diagram that outlines the interactions between the computerized
information system and external entities. Show the system's boundaries and data flow. (10 Marks) 
(c)Data Flow Diagrams: Create a Level 0 Data Flow Diagram (DFD) for the computerized information
system. Include main processes and data flows, showing how information moves through the system.
(10 Marks) 
(d)Entity Relationship Diagrams: Construct an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD). Define entities,
attributes, and relationships clearly. (10 Marks) 

(e)Network Models: Discuss the appropriate network model for the computerized information system.
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of the chosen model. (10 Marks) 
(f)Approaches to Implementation: Select one approach to system implementation (e.g., big bang, phased,
parallel). Justify your selection by discussing its advantages and disadvantages. (10 Marks) 
(g)User Support and Training: Discuss strategies for ensuring effective user adoption. (10 Marks)
TASK 2: POSTER (10 MARKS)
Recommended completion: 29
th
 August 2025
Create a poster that visually represents the key aspects of the computerized information system you have been
analyzing and designing. The poster will serve as a concise and engaging summary of the system's main features,
processes, and benefits. 
Your poster should cover the following main points:
•System Overview: Include a brief description of the computerized information system, highlighting its
purpose, main functions, and intended users. 
•Benefits: Emphasize the benefits and advantages of the system, such as improved efficiency, accuracy,
user experience, and overall impact on the organization. 
•Technological Aspects: Briefly mention any specific technologies, tools, or platforms used in the system's
development, such as programming languages, databases, or cloud services.
You are encouraged to use design elements that make the poster visually appealing and easy to understand. Utilize
appropriate fonts, colors, images, and diagrams to enhance clarity. The poster should be designed to fit an A3
paper size (297 mm x 420 mm). Use portrait orientation for optimal readability. Submit BOTH the HARD COPY
(laminated) and SOFT COPY of your poster as part of your Assignment 2 submission. The soft copy should be
in a common image format (e.g., JPEG, PNG) or a PDF file. 
TASK 3: PEER EVALUATION (20 MARKS)
SUBMISSION: INDIVIDUAL SUBMISSION
Recommended completion: 30
th
 August 2025
Please evaluate each group member's individual contribution to the project based on the criteria provided in the
peer evaluation form. Submit the form individually via the link provided on the HLMS. Failure to submit this
form will result in the deduction of your peer evaluation marks.
